com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class ReparentStripeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.ReparentStripeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IReparentStripeHandler

    public class ReparentStripeHandler
extends Object
implements IReparentStripeHandler
    Default implementation of the IReparentStripeHandler interface.

    This implementation allows to specify a maximal nesting depth for reparent operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReparentStripeHandler

    • Method Detail

      • adjustSize

        protected void adjustSize(IInputModeContext context,
                          IStripe stripe,
                          IStripe newParent,
                          StripeReparentPolicy reparentPosition,
                          int index,
                          double originalStripeSize,
                          double originalParentSize)
        Adjust the size of the source or the target stripe.

        This implementation adjusts the size of stripe to Math.Max(originalStripeSize, originalParentSize) if reparentPosition is an StripeReparentPolicy.ADD_CHILD operation

        Parameters:
        context - The context that provides information about the user input.
        stripe - The stripe that will be reparented.
        newParent - The potential new parent.
        index - The index where the stripe should be inserted.
        reparentPosition - Where to place the stripe as a result of the gesture that triggered the reparent operation.
        originalStripeSize - The original size of stripe
        originalParentSize - The original size of newParent

      • getMaxColumnLevel

        public final int getMaxColumnLevel()
        The maximum nesting level the column hierarchy may acquire during a reparent gesture.

        Note that it is always possible to decrease the nesting depth, even if the resulting depth would still be too high. This allows to interactively reduce an invalid nesting depth in multiple steps. The default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE, which effectively means an unlimited nesting depth.

        Returns:
        The MaxColumnLevel.
        See Also:
        setMaxColumnLevel(int)

      • getMaxRowLevel

        public final int getMaxRowLevel()
        The maximum nesting level the row hierarchy may acquire during a reparent gesture.

        Note that it is always possible to decrease the nesting depth, even if the resulting depth would still be too high. This allows to interactively reduce an invalid nesting depth in multiple steps. The default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE, which effectively means an unlimited nesting depth.

        Returns:
        The MaxRowLevel.
        See Also:
        setMaxRowLevel(int)

      • isValidParent

        public boolean isValidParent(IInputModeContext context,
                             IStripe stripe,
                             IStripe newParent,
                             int index,
                             StripeReparentPolicy reparentPosition)
        Checks the constraints imposed by MaxRowLevel or MaxColumnLevel for a valid gesture.
        Specified by:
        isValidParent in interface IReparentStripeHandler
        Parameters:
        context - The context that provides information about the user input.
        stripe - The stripe that will be reparented.
        newParent - The potential new parent.
        index - The index where the stripe would be reparented
        reparentPosition - Where to place the stripe as a result of the gesture that would be used for the reparent(IInputModeContext, IStripe, IStripe, int, StripeReparentPolicy) operation.
        Returns:
        true iff the resulting nesting depth is smaller than MaxRowLevel or MaxColumnLevel, or if the nesting depth would not increase by the operation.

      • reparent

        public void reparent(IInputModeContext context,
                     IStripe stripe,
                     IStripe newParent,
                     int index,
                     StripeReparentPolicy reparentPosition)
        Performs the actual reparenting after the reparent gesture has been finalized.

        This implementation adjusts the size of the moved and/or the target stripe by calling adjustSize(IInputModeContext, IStripe, IStripe, StripeReparentPolicy, int, double, double) .

        Specified by:
        reparent in interface IReparentStripeHandler
        Parameters:
        context - The context that provides information about the user input.
        stripe - The stripe that will be reparented.
        newParent - The potential new parent.
        index - The index where the stripe should be inserted.
        reparentPosition - Where to place the stripe as a result of the gesture that triggered the reparent operation.

      • setMaxColumnLevel

        public final void setMaxColumnLevel(int value)
        The maximum nesting level the column hierarchy may acquire during a reparent gesture.

        Note that it is always possible to decrease the nesting depth, even if the resulting depth would still be too high. This allows to interactively reduce an invalid nesting depth in multiple steps. The default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE, which effectively means an unlimited nesting depth.

        Parameters:
        value - The MaxColumnLevel to set.
        See Also:
        getMaxColumnLevel()

      • setMaxRowLevel

        public final void setMaxRowLevel(int value)
        The maximum nesting level the row hierarchy may acquire during a reparent gesture.

        Note that it is always possible to decrease the nesting depth, even if the resulting depth would still be too high. This allows to interactively reduce an invalid nesting depth in multiple steps. The default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE, which effectively means an unlimited nesting depth.

        Parameters:
        value - The MaxRowLevel to set.
        See Also:
        getMaxRowLevel()

      • shouldReparent

        public boolean shouldReparent(IInputModeContext context,
                              IStripe stripe)
        Determines whether the user may detach the given stripe from its current parent in order to reparent it.
        Specified by:
        shouldReparent in interface IReparentStripeHandler
        Parameters:
        context - The context that provides information about the user input.
        stripe - The stripe that is about to be detached from its current parent.
        Returns:
        This implementation returns always true.
